ingredientsNeeded: 1 lb chicken breasts (cut into thin strips)
2–3 cups mixed stir-fry vegetables (bell peppers, onions, carrots, broccoli)
2 cups cooked brown rice (about 1 cup dry)
steps: Cook the rice (if not already done). Follow package instructions for brown rice (usually ~25–30 minutes).
Prep chicken and veggies: Cut chicken into strips; wash and chop veggies into bite-size pieces.
Stir-fry chicken: Heat oil in a wok or large skillet on medium-high heat. Add chicken strips; season with salt and pepper. Cook until browned (about 5–6 minutes).
Add veggies: Toss in vegetables; stir-fry for another 4–5 minutes until slightly tender.
Season: Add minced garlic, ginger, and soy sauce. Stir to coat.
Serve: Spoon stir-fry over brown rice and enjoy.

recipes.recipeName: Chicken and Veggie Sheet Pan Bake
ingredientsNeeded: 2–3 carrots or zucchini, sliced into chunks
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Chop and toss: Place chicken, peppers, onions, potatoes, and carrots/zucchini on a large baking sheet.
Season: Drizzle with olive oil; sprinkle with rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper. Toss everything to coat evenly.
Arrange: Spread out so everything is in a single layer.
Bake: Cook for ~30 minutes (flip chicken/veggies halfway) or until chicken is cooked through and veggies are tender.
Serve warm.

ingredientsNeeded: 1 can tomato sauce or crushed tomatoes (~8 oz)
1 can beans (kidney or black), drained and rinsed
steps: Sauté veggies: In a pot or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium. Add onion and bell pepper; cook 3–4 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute.
Add chicken: If raw, add cubed chicken now; cook until lightly browned. If pre-cooked, add after broth in next step.
Combine: Add diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, beans, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, and ~1 cup chicken broth. Stir to combine.
Simmer: Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce heat. Simmer 30–40 minutes (add more broth if it thickens too much).
Taste and adjust: Season with more salt or spices as needed.
Serve hot (top with cilantro, low-fat cheese, or yogurt if desired).

ingredientsNeeded: 1 lb flank or sirloin steak (thinly sliced)
1 tsp cornstarch (mixed in ¼ cup water)
steps: Prep marinade (optional): Toss beef with half the soy sauce, ginger, and garlic. Let sit ~10 minutes.
Cook beef: Heat oil in a wok or skillet over high heat. Stir-fry beef for 2–3 minutes until browned; remove and set aside.
Add broccoli (& onion): Stir-fry 2–3 minutes until broccoli is slightly tender.
Combine: Return beef to pan. Add remaining soy sauce. Stir in cornstarch slurry.
Thicken: Cook another 1–2 minutes until sauce thickens. Season as needed.
Serve with rice or noodles.

ingredientsNeeded: 4 large bell peppers (tops cut off, seeds removed)
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brown ground beef: In a skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until beef is no longer pink. Drain excess fat if needed.
Add seasoning: Stir in cooked rice, diced tomatoes (optional), oregano, salt, and pepper. Let simmer a few minutes.
Stuff peppers: Spoon beef mixture into bell peppers.

Bake: Place stuffed peppers upright in a baking dish with a little water at the bottom. Cover with foil; bake ~20 minutes. If adding cheese, sprinkle it on top and bake uncovered another 5–10 minutes until melted.
Serve hot.

ingredientsNeeded: 8 oz whole wheat pasta (penne or fusilli)
2–3 cups mixed vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
Salt, pepper, Italian seasoning to taste
steps: Cook pasta: According to package directions. Reserve ~½ cup cooking water.
Sauté veggies: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic, then chopped vegetables. Cook ~5–6 minutes until tender.
Combine: Add drained pasta to pan with veggies. Stir in a bit of reserved pasta water to create a light sauce.
Season: Add salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning. Toss to coat well.
Serve: Top with grated Parmesan if desired.
